author: Vivek Narayanan
text:
The Central Crime Branch police here have registered a case in connection with the abduction of a city-based novelist, Shreekumar Varma, in Senegal. Mr. Varma’s son Karthik lodged a complaint with the City Police Commissioner on Thursday evening.

“We registered a case and before we could start the investigation, his son told us that Mr. Varma was freed. So, further action will be taken only after he returns,” a police officer said. One Ibrahim contacted Mr. Karthik and said he was also kidnapped along with his father and the abductors were demanding a ransom of €2.5 million.

Police sources said Mr. Varma was expected on Friday night or Saturday.

It is alleged that Mr. Varma was taken to a seaside hotel after being abducted. “Since he came to know he wouldn’t be able to meet his contact, he booked the return flight. However, it is alleged that he was purposely delayed and he missed the flight,” said a source.

A man named Abdul took his passport purportedly for booking flight tickets.
title: Likely to return today
